
     Vocabulary 33000

abase
우리말 뜻: 떨어 뜨리다, 낮추다; 창피를 주다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lower; humiliate
예문: His refusal to abase himself in the eyes of his followers irritated the king, who wanted to humiliate him.
abash
우리말 뜻: 당황시키다, 창피스럽게 만들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: embarass
예문: He was not at all abashed by her open admiration.
abdicate
우리말 뜻: 포기하다, 저버리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: renounce, give up
예문: When Edward VIII abdicated the British throne, he surprised the entire world.
abettor
우리말 뜻: 사주자, 범죄를 부추기는 사람
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: encourager
예문: He was accused of being an aider and abettor of the criminal.
abeyance
우리말 뜻: 중지, 정지
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: suspended action
예문: The deal was held in abeyance until his arrival.
abhor
우리말 뜻: 혐오하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: detest, hate
예문: He abhorred all forms of bigotry.
abjure
우리말 뜻: 저버리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: renounce upon oath
예문: He abjured his allegiance to the king.
ablution
우리말 뜻: 씻기; 종교예식에서 몸을 깨끗이 씻음
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: washing of the body
예문: His daily ablutions were accompanied by loud noises which he humorously labeled "Opera in the Bath."
abominate
우리말 뜻: 혐오하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: loathe, hate
예문: Moses abominated idol worship.
aboriginal
우리말 뜻: 원산의, 원주민의, 토착의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: being the first of its kind in a region; primitive; native
예문: His studies of the primitive art forms of the aboriginal Indians were widely reported in the scientific journals.
abortive
우리말 뜻: 실패한, 결실이 전혀 없는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unsuccessful; fruitless
예문: We had to abandon our abortive attempts.
abrade
우리말 뜻: 마찰시키다, 긁히다; 찰과상을 입다; 깍여 나가다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: wear away by friction; erode
예문: The skin of his leg was abraded by the sharp rocks.
abrogate
우리말 뜻: 폐지하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: abolish
예문: He intended to abrogate the decree issued by his predecessor.
abscond
우리말 뜻: 몰래 도망치다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: depart secretly and hide
예문: The teller absconded with the bonds issued by his predecessor.
absolve
우리말 뜻: 용서하다; 면죄시키다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pardon (an offense)
예문: The father absolved the confessor of his sins.
abstemious
우리말 뜻: 절제적인; 담배, 술등을 삼가는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: temperate; sparing in drink, etc.
예문: The drunkards mocked him because of his abstemious habits.
abstinence
우리말 뜻: 절제; 금주, 금식
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: restraint from eating or drinking
예문: The doctor recommended total abstinence from alcoholic beverages.
acute
우리말 뜻: 예리한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: quickly perceptive. keen. brief and severe
예문: The acute young doctor realized immediately that the gradual deterioration of her patient's once-acute hearing was due to a chronic illness, not an acute one.
affiliation
우리말 뜻: 입회, 제휴
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: joining; associating with
예문: His affiliation with the political party was of short duration for he soon disagreed with his colleagues.
affinity
우리말 뜻: 인척관계
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: kinship
예문: She felt an affinity with all who suffered; their pains were her pains.
affirmation
우리말 뜻: 확언, 단언
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: solemn pledge by one who refuses to take an oath
예문: The Constitution of this country provides for oath or affirmation by officeholders.
affluence
우리말 뜻: 풍부, 부유
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: abundance; wealth
예문: Foreigners are amazed by the affluence and luxury of the American way of life.
affray
우리말 뜻: 싸움, 소란
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: public brawl
예문: He was badly mauled by the fighters in the affray.
agape
우리말 뜻: 입을 딱 벌리고, 아연하여
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: openmouthed
예문: She stared, agape, at the many strange animals in the zoo.
agenda
우리말 뜻: 의사일정
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: items of business at a meeting
예문: We had so much difficulty agreeing upon an agenda that there was very little time for the meeting.
agglomeration
우리말 뜻: 덩어리로 만듦, 응집작용
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: collection; heap
예문: It took weeks to assort the agglomeration of miscellaneous items she had collected on her trip.
aggrandize
우리말 뜻: 크게하다, 강화하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: increase or intensify
예문: The history of the past quarter century illustrates how a President may aggrandize his power to act aggressively in international affairs without considering the wishes of Congress.
aggregate
우리말 뜻: 총계의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sum; total
예문: The aggregate wealth of this country is staggering to the imagination.
aghast
우리말 뜻: 깜짝 놀라, 혼비백산하여
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: horrified
예문: He was aghast at the nerve of the speaker who had insulted his host.
agility
우리말 뜻: 민첩
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: nimbleness
예문: The agility of the acrobat amazed and thrilled the audience.
agitate
우리말 뜻: 흔들다, 선동하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: stir up; disturb
예문: Her fiery remarks agitated the already angry mob.
agnostic
우리말 뜻: 불가지론자
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: one who is skeptical of the exitstence or knowability of a god
예문: The agnostic demanded proof before she would accept the statement of the minister.
agrarian
우리말 뜻: 농지의, 토지의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pertaining to land or its cultivation
예문: The country is gradually losing its agrarian occupation and turning more and more to an industrial point of view.
alacrity
우리말 뜻: 민첩, 활기
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cheerful promptness
예문: He demonstrated his eagerness to serve by his alacity in executing the orders of his master.
alchemy
우리말 뜻: 연금술
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: medieval chemistry
예문: The changing of baser metals into gold was the goal of the students of alchemy.
alcove
우리말 뜻: 우묵들어간 곳
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: nook; recess
예문: Though their apartment lacked a fullscale dining room, an alcove adjacent to the living room made an adequate breakfast nook for the young couple.
alias
우리말 뜻: 일명, 별명
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: an assumed name
예문: John Smith's alias was Bob Jones.
alienate
우리말 뜻: <친구 등을>멀리하다, 이간하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: make hostile; separate
예문: Her attempts to alienate the two friends failed because they had complete faith in each other.
alimentary
우리말 뜻: 영양의, 소화의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: supplying nourishment
예문: The aliementary canal in our bodies is so named because digestion of foods occurs there.
alimony
우리말 뜻: 별거수당
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: payment by a husband to his divorced wife
예문: Mrs. Jones was awarded $200 monthly alimony by the court when she was divorced from her husband.
allay
우리말 뜻: 진정시키다, <고통, 슬픔 등을>완화하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: calm; pacify
예문: The crew tried to allay the fears of the passengers by announcing that the fire had been controlled.
allege
우리말 뜻: 단언하다, 우겨대다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: state without proof
예문: It is alleged that she had worked for the enemy.
allegory
우리말 뜻: 풍유; 우화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: story in which characters are used as symbols; fable
예문: "Pilgrim's Progress" is an allegory of the temptations and victories of man's soul.
apparition
우리말 뜻: 유령; 환영
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ghost; phantom
예문: Hamlet was uncertain about the identity of the apparition that had appeared and spoken to him.
appease
우리말 뜻: <식욕, 공복 등을> 만족시키다, 달래다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pacify; soothe
예문: We have discovered that, when we try to appease our enemies, we encourage them to make additional demands.
appellation
우리말 뜻: 명칭; 통칭
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: name; title
예문: He was amazed when the witches hailed him with his correct appellation.
append
우리말 뜻: 덧붙이다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: attach
예문: I shall append this chart to my report.
application
우리말 뜻: 열심, 몰두
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: diligent attention
예문: Pleased with how well Tom had whitewashed the fence, Aunt Polly praised him for his application.(secondary meaning)
apposite
우리말 뜻: 적절한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: appropriate; fitting
예문: He was always able to find the apposite phrase, the correct ｅxpression for every occasion.
appraise
우리말 뜻: <물건, 재산을>값매기다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: estimate value of
예문: It is difficult to appraise the value of old paintings; it is easier to call them priceless.
appreciate
우리말 뜻: 고맙게 생각하다, 진가를 인정하다, 올바르게 인식하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: be thankful for; increase in worth; be thoroughly conscious of
예문: Little Orphan Annie truly appreciated the stocks Daddy Warbucks gave her, whose value appreciated considerably over the years.
apprehend
우리말 뜻: 체포하다; 깨닫다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: arrest(a criminal); perceive
예문: The police will apprehend the culprit before long.
apprehensive
우리말 뜻: 우려하여; 통찰력이 있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fearful; discerning
예문: His apprehensive glances at the people who were walking in the street revealed his nervousness.
apprise
우리말 뜻: <사람에게 ~를 >통고하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: inform
예문: When he was apprised of the dangerous weather conditions, he decided to postpone his trip.
approbation
우리말 뜻: 승인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: approval
예문: She looked for some sign of approbation from her parents.
appropriate
우리말 뜻: 충당하다; <공공물을>전유하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: acpuire; take possession of for one's own use
예문: The ranch owners appropriated the lands that had originally been set aside for the Indians' use.
appurtenances
우리말 뜻: 부속물
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: subordinate possessions
예문: He bought the estate and all its appurtenances.
apropos
우리말 뜻: ~의 이야기로 생각났는데; ~에 관하여
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: with reference to; regarding
예문: I find your remarks apropos of the present situation timely and pertinent.
aptitude
우리말 뜻: 적절함; 재능
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fitness; talent
예문: The counselor gave him an aptitude test before advising him about the career he should follow.
awe
우리말 뜻: 경외
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: solemn wonder
예문: The tourists gazed with awe at the tremendous expanse of the Grand Canyon.
awry
우리말 뜻: 뒤틀어져; 구부러져
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: distorted; crooked
예문: He held his head awry, giving the impression that he had caught cold in his neck during the night.
azure
우리말 뜻: 하늘빛
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sky blue
예문: Azure skies are indicative of good weather.
babble
우리말 뜻: <어린애들의>서투른 말로 종알거리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: chatter idly
예문: The little girl babbled about her doll.
badger
우리말 뜻: (장난삼아)집적대다; 괴롭히다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pester; annoy
예문: She was forced to change her telephone number because she was badgered by obscene phone calls.
badinage
우리말 뜻: 농담
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: teasing conversation
예문: Her friends at work greeted the news of her engagement with cheerful badinage.
baffle
우리말 뜻: <계획, 노력 등을>좌절시키다; 당황하게 하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: frustrate; perplex
예문: The new code baffled the enemy agents.
bagatelle
우리말 뜻: 하찮은 것
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: trifle
예문: Trying to reassure Roxanne about his wound, Cyrano claimed it was a mere bagatelle.
bait
우리말 뜻: 괴롭히다; 집적거리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harass; tease
예문: The soldiers baited the prisoners, terrorizing them.
baleful
우리말 뜻: 해로운; 불길한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deadly; destructive
예문: The drought was a baleful omen.
balk
우리말 뜻: 방해하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: foil
예문: When the warden learned that several inmates were planning to escape, he took steps to balk their attempt.
ballast
우리말 뜻: 바닥짐(배에 실은 짐이 적을때 배의 안전을 위하여 바닥에 싣는 돌, 모래)
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: heavy substance used to add stability or weight
예문: The ship was listing badly to one side; it was necessary to shift the ballast in the hold to get her back on an even keel.
balm
우리말 뜻: 진통제
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: something that relieves pain
예문: Friendship is the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
balmy
우리말 뜻: 향유의; 향기로운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mild; fragrant
예문: A balmy breeze refreshed us after the sultry blast.
banal
우리말 뜻: 진부한; 평범한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hackneyed; commonplace; trite
예문: His frequent use of cliches made his essay seem banal.
bane
우리말 뜻: 파멸의 원인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cause of ruin
예문: Lack of public transportation is the bane of urban life.
baneful
우리말 뜻: 유독한; 유해한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ruinous; poisonous
예문: His baneful influence was feared by all.
burgeon
우리말 뜻: 싹트다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: grow forth; send out buds
예문: In the spring, the plants that burgeon are a promise of the beauty that is to come.
burlesque
우리말 뜻: 익살부리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: give an imitation that ridicules
예문: In his caricature, he burlesqued the mannerisms of his adversary.
burly
우리말 뜻: 퉁명스러운; <몸이>억센
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: husky; muscular
예문: The burly mover lifted the packing crate with ease.
burnish
우리말 뜻: 닦다; 갈다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: make shiny by rubbing; polish
예문: They burnished the metal until it reflected the lamplihgt.
buttress
우리말 뜻: 부벽; 버팀
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: support or prop
예문: The huge cathedral walls were supported by flying buttresses.
buxom
우리말 뜻: 포동포동한; 건강하고 쾌활한; 명랑한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: plump; vigorous; jolly
예문: The soldiers remembered the buxom nurse who had always been so pleasant to them.
cabal
우리말 뜻: 음모단
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: small group of persons secretly united to promote their own interests
예문: The cabal was defeated when their scheme was discovered.
cache
우리말 뜻: 은닉처
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hiding place
예문: The detectives followed the suspect until he led them to the cache where he had stored his loot.
cacophony
우리말 뜻: 불협화음
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: discord
예문: Some people seem to enjoy the cacophony of an orchestra that is tuning up.
cadaver
우리말 뜻: <특히 해부용 사람의>시체
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: corpse
예문: In some states, it is illegal to dissect cadavers.
cadaverous
우리말 뜻: 시체같은; 새파랗게 질린
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: like a corpse; pale
예문: By his cadaverous appearance, we could see how the disease had ravaged him.
cajole
우리말 뜻: 감언이설로 속이다; 아첨하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: coax; wheedle
예문: I will not be cajoled into granting you your wish.
calamity
우리말 뜻: 재난; 참화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disaster; misery
예문: As news of the calamity spread, offers of relief poured in to the stricken community.
caliber
우리말 뜻: 재간; 도량
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ability; capacity
예문: A man of such caliber should not be assigned such menial tasks.
calligraphy
우리말 뜻: 달필; 서법
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: beautiful writing; excellent penmanship
예문: As we examine ancient manuscripts, we become impressed with the calligraphy of the scribes.
callous
우리말 뜻: <피부가>굳어진; 무감각한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hardened; unfeeling
예문: He had worked in the hospital for so many years that he was callous to the suffering in the wards.
callow
우리말 뜻: 애숭이인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: youthful; immature
예문: In that youthful movement, the leaders were only a little less callow than their immature followers.
calorific
우리말 뜻: 열을 발생하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: heat-producing
예문: Coal is much more calorific than green wood.
calumniate
우리말 뜻: 중상하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: slander
예문: Shakespeare wrote that love and friendship were subject to envious and caluminating time.
calumny
우리말 뜻: 비방; 중상
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: malicious misrepresentation; slander
예문: He could endure his financial failure, but he could not bear the calumny that his foes heaped upon him.
camaraderie
우리말 뜻: 우정
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: good-fellowship
예문: What he loved best about his job was the sense of camaraderie he and his co-workers shared.
cameo
우리말 뜻: 카메오 세공
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: shell or jewel carved in relief
예문: Tourists are advised not to purchase cameos from the street peddlers of Rome who sell poor specimens of the carver's art.
canard
우리말 뜻: 헛소문; 유언비어
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unfounded rumor; exaggerated report
예문: It is almost impossible to protect oneself from such a base canard.
cardial
우리말 뜻: l진심에서 우러나오는,따듯한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hearty,affectioate
예문:
censor
우리말 뜻: 검열관. 까다롭게 남의 흠을 잡는 사람
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: overseer of morals. person who reads to eliminate inappropriate remarks
예문: Soldiers dislike having their mail read by a censor but understand the need for this precaution.
churlish
우리말 뜻: 천한; 야비한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: boorish; rude
예문: Dismayed by his churlish manners at the party, the girls vowed never to invite him again.
ciliated
우리말 뜻: 속눈썹(솜털)이 있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: having minute hairs
예문: The paramecium is a ciliated, one-celled animal.
cipher
우리말 뜻: 삭제하지 않음; 변변치 않은 사람(물건)
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: nonentity; worthless person or thing
예문: She claimed her ex-husband was a total cipher and wondered why she had ever married him.
cipher1
우리말 뜻: 암호
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: secret code
예문: Lacking his code book, the spy was unable to decode the message sent to him in cipher.
circlet
우리말 뜻: 작은 원; 장식고리
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: small ring; band
예문: This tiny circlet is very costly because it is set with precious stones.
circuitous
우리말 뜻: 빙도는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: roundabout
예문: Because of the traffic congestion on the main highways, she took a circuitous route.
circumlocution
우리말 뜻: 에둘러말함; 핑계
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: indirect or roundabout ｅxpression
예문: He was afraid to call a spade a spade and resorted to circumlocutions to avoid direct reference to his subject.
circumscribe
우리말 뜻: 제한하다; 한계를 정한다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: limit; confine
예문: Although I do not wish to circumscribe your activities, I must insist that you complete this assignment before you start anything else.
circumspect
우리말 뜻: 신중한; 조심성있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: prudent; cautious
예문: Investigating before acting, she tried always to be circumspect.
circumvent
우리말 뜻: 일주하다; 포위하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: outwit; baffle
예문: In order to circumvent the enemy, we will make two preliminary starting our major campaign.
collaborate
우리말 뜻: 협조하다, 협동하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: work together
예문: Two writers collaborated in preparing this book.
collage
우리말 뜻: 콜라쥬(사진, 신문, 철사 등의 조각을 붙여 만드는 작품 기법)
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: work of art put together from fragments.
예문: Scraps of cloth, paper dollies, and old photographs all went into her collage.
collate
우리말 뜻: 대조하다, 비교하다; 정열하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: examine in order to verify authenticity; arrange in order
예문: They collated the newly found manuscripts to determine their age.
colloquial
우리말 뜻: 대화체의, 구어체적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pertaining to conversational or common speech
예문: Your use of colloquial ｅxpressions in a formal essay such as the one you have presented spoils the effect you hope to achieve.
colloquy
우리말 뜻: 담화, 대화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: informal discussion
예문: I enjoy our colloquies, but I sometimes wish that they could be made more formal and more searching.
collusion
우리말 뜻: 공모, 음모
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: conspiring in a fraudulent scheme
예문: The swindlers were found guilty of collusion.
colossal
우리말 뜻: 엄청나게 큰, 거대한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: huge
예문: Radio City Music Hall has a colossal stage that can accomodate up to 15,000 people.
colossus
우리말 뜻: 거상,거대한 물건
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: gigantic statue
예문: The lengendary Colossus of Rhodes, a bronze statue of the sun god that dominated the horbor of the Greek seaport, was one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
comatose
우리말 뜻: 혼수상태의,몹시 졸리운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: in a coma; extremely sleepy
예문: The long-winded orator soon had his audience in a comatose state.
combustible
우리말 뜻: 연소할 수 있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: easily burned
예문: After the recent outbreak of fires in private homes, the fire commissioner ordered that all combustible materials be kept in safe containers.
comely
우리말 뜻: 매력적인,보기좋은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: attractive; agreeable
예문: I would rather have a poor and comely wife than a rich and homely one.
comestible
우리말 뜻: 식료품
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: something fit to be eaten
예문: The roast turkey and other comestible, the wines,and the excellent service made this Thanksgiving dinner particularly memorable.
comeuppance
우리말 뜻: 천벌, 인과응보
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: rebuke; deserts
예문: After his earlier rudeness, we were delighted to see him get his comeuppance.
comity
우리말 뜻: 예의바름,공손
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: courtesy; civility
예문: A spirit of comity should exist among nations.
commandeer
우리말 뜻: 징발하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: to draft for military purposes; to take for public use
예문: The policeman commandeered the first car that approached and ordered the driver to go to the nearst hospital.
commemorative
우리말 뜻: 기념할 만한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: remembering; honoring
예문: The new commemorative stamps honors the late Martin Luther King,Jr.
commensurate
우리말 뜻: 동량의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: equal in extent
예문: Your reward will be commensurate with your effort.
commiserate
우리말 뜻: 동정하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: feel or express pity or sympathy for
예문: Her friends commiserated with the widow.
commodious
우리말 뜻: 널찍하고 편리한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: spacious and comfortable
예문: After sleeping in small roadside cabins, they found their hotel suite commodious.
communal
우리말 뜻: 공동사회의, 공동의,공용의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: held in common; of a group of people
예문: When they were divorced, they had trouble dividing their communal property.
compact
우리말 뜻: 조약,협약,계약
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: agreement, contract
예문: The signers of the Mayflower Compact were establishing a form of government.
compactadj
우리말 뜻: 압축된,단단한,소형의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: tightly packed;firm;brief
예문: His short,compact body was better suited to wrestling than to basketball.
compatible
우리말 뜻: 양립할 수 있는, 서로 어울리는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harmonious; in harmony with
예문: They were compatible neighbors, never quarreling over unimportant matters.
compelling
우리말 뜻: 강력한, 압도적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: overpowering; irresistible in effect
예문: The prosecutor presented a well-reasoned case, but the defense attorney's compelling arguments for leniency won over the jury.
compendium
우리말 뜻: 요약
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: brief, comprehensive summary
예문: This text can serve as a compendium of the tremendous amount of new material being developed in this field.
compensatory
우리말 뜻: 보상적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: making up for; repaying
예문: Can a compensatory education program make up for the inadequate schooling he received in earler years?
compilation
우리말 뜻: 편찬, 자료정리
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: listing of statistical information in tabular or book form
예문: The compilation of available scholarships serves a very valuable purpose.
complacent
우리말 뜻: 자기 만족적인, 느긋한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: self-satisfied
예문: There was a complacent look on his face as he examined his paintings.
complaisant
우리말 뜻: 상냥한, 고분고분한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: trying to please; obliging
예문: The courtier obeyed the king's orders in a complaisant manner.
complement
우리말 뜻: 보충하다, 보완하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: complete; consummate; make perfect
예문: The waiter recommended a glass of port to complement the cheese.
compliance
우리말 뜻: 부응, 일치, 따름
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: conformity in fulfilling requirements; readiness to yield
예문: The design for the new school had to be in compliance with the local building code.
compliant
우리말 뜻: 순응하는, 복종적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: yielding
예문: He was compliant and ready to go along with his friend's desires.
complicity
우리말 뜻: 공모, 연루
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: participation; involvement
예문: You cannot keep your complicity in this affair secret very long; you would be wise to admit your involvement immediately.
component
우리말 뜻: 부품, 부분
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: element; ingredient
예문: I wish all the components of my stereo system were working at the same time.
comport
우리말 뜻: 행동하다, 처신하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bear one's self; behave
예문: He comported himself with great dignity
composure
우리말 뜻: 냉정, 침착
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mental calmness
예문: Even the lastest work crisis failed to shake her composure.
compound
우리말 뜻: 합성하다, 섞다; 복리로 계산하다; 더 복잡하게 만들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: combine; constitute; pay interest; increase
예문: The makers of the popular cold remedy compounded a nasal decongestant with an antihistamine.
comprehensive
우리말 뜻: 종합적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thorough; inclusive
예문: This book provides a comprehensive review of verbal and math skills for the GRE.
compress
우리말 뜻: 압축하다; 꽉 조이다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: close; squeeze; contract
예문: She compressed the package under her arm.
compromise
우리말 뜻: 타협하다, 조정하다; 위협하다, 위험에 빠뜨리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: adjust; endanger the interests or reputation of
예문: Your presence at the scene of the dispute compromises our claim to neutrality in this matter.
compunction
우리말 뜻: 후회, 참회
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: remorse
예문: The judge was especially severe in his sentencing because he felt that the criminal had shown no compunction for his heinous crime.
compute
우리말 뜻: 계산하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reckon; calculate
예문: He failed to compute the interest, so his bank balance was not accurate.
concatenate
우리말 뜻: 줄지어 연결하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: link as in a chain
예문: It is difficult to understand how these events could concatenate as they did without outside assistance.
concave
우리말 뜻: 오목한, 움푹 들어간
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hollow
예문: The back-packers found partial shelter from the storm by huddling against the concave wall of the cliff.
conceit
우리말 뜻: 기행, 기발한 생각; 지나친 비유
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: whimsical idea; extravagant metaphor
예문: He was an entertaining companion, always expressing himself in amusing conceits and witty turns of phrase.
concentric
우리말 뜻: 동심원적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: having a common center
예문: The target was made of concentric circles.
conception
우리말 뜻: 생각을 품음, 개념을 형성함
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: beginning; forming of an idea
예문: At the first conception of the work, he was consulted.
concerted
우리말 뜻: 협조적인, 힘을 합쳐 이루어진
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mutually agreed on; done together
예문: The Girl Scouts in the troop made a concerted effort to raise funds for their annual outing, and emitted a concerted sigh when their leader announced that they had reached their goal.
concession
우리말 뜻: 양보
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: an act of yielding
예문: Before they could reach an agreement, both sides had to make certain concessions.
conciliatory
우리말 뜻: 화해적인, 위무적인, 달래는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reconciling; soothing
예문: She was still angry despite his conciliatory words.
concise
우리말 뜻: 간결한, 간략한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: brief and compact
예문: When you define a new word, be concise: the shorter the definition, the easier it is to remember.
conclave
우리말 뜻: 비밀 모임
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: private meeting
예문: He was present at all their conclaves as an unofficial observer.
conclusive
우리말 뜻: 결정적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: decisive; ending all debate
예문: When the stolen books turned up in John's locker, we finally had conclusive evidence of the identity of the mysterious thief.
concoct
우리말 뜻: 조리하다, 만들어 내다; 생각 등을 짜내다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: prepare by combining; make up in concert
예문: How did the inventive chef ever concoct such a strange dish?
concomitant
우리말 뜻: 부수물; 부수적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: that which accompanies; accompanying
예문: Culture is not always a concomitant of wealth.
concord
우리말 뜻: 일치; 조화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harmony
예문: Watching Tweedledum and Tweedledee battle, Alice wondered why the two brothers could not manage to live in concord.
concur
우리말 뜻: 동의하다, 일치하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: agree
예문: Did you concur with the decision of the court or did you find it unfair?
concurrent
우리말 뜻: 동시 발생적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: happening at the same time
예문: In America, the colonists were resisting the demands of the mother country; at the concurrent moment in France, the middle class was sowing the seeds of rebellion.
condescend
우리말 뜻: 겸손하게 처신하다; 자신을 낮추다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bestow courtesies with a superior air
예문: The king condescended to grant an audience to the friends of the condemned man.
condign
우리말 뜻: 적절한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: adequate; deservedly severe
예문: The publc approved the condign punishment for the crime.
condiments

영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: seasonings; spices
예문: Spanish food is full of condiments.

예문: The army confiscated all acailable supplies of uranium.

countenance

예문:
countermand
우리말 뜻: 취소하다. 소환하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: recall,call back
예문:
counterpart
우리말 뜻: 서로 보완하는 2개 중의 하나,대응하는 것.비슷한 것.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: a thing that completes another;things very much alike
예문: Night and day are counterparts.
coup
우리말 뜻: (장사,사업등에서의) 대성공,쿠데타
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: highly successful action or sudden attack
예문: As the news of his coup spread throughout Wall Street,his fellow brokers dropped by to congratulate him.
couple
우리말 뜻: 결혼하다.결합하다.연결하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: join,unite,
예문: The Flying Karamazovs couple expert juggling and amateur joking in their nightclub act.
courier
우리말 뜻: 급사,급한 소식을 전하는 사람,(관광 회사의)가이드,여행안내인.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: messenger
예문: The publisher sent a special courier to pick up the manuscript.
covenant
우리말 뜻: 계약,서약.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: agreement
예문: We must comply with the terms of the covenant.
covert
우리말 뜻: 은밀한.숨겨진,암시된.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: secret;hidden;implied.
예문: She could understand the covert threat in the letter.
covetous
우리말 뜻: 턱 없이 탐욕스러운,탐내는, 열망하는.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: avaricious;eagerly desirous of.
예문: The child was covetous by nature and wanted to take the toys belonging to his classmates.
cow
우리말 뜻: (폭력 따위로)...울 으르다. 위협하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: terrorize;intimidate.
예문: The little boy was so cowed by the hulking bully that he gave up his lunch money without a word of protest.
cower
우리말 뜻: (부끄러움,공포 때문에)움츠리다.위축되다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: shrink quivering, as from fear.
예문: The frightened child cowered in the corner of the room.
coy
우리말 뜻: 수줍어 하는,요염한.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: shy,modest,coquttish
예문: She was coy in her answers to his offer.
cozen
우리말 뜻: ...을 속이다.기만하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cheat, hoodwink,swindle.
예문: He was the kind of individual who would cozen his friends in a cheap card game but remain eminently ethical in all his business dealings.
crabbed
우리말 뜻: 성미가 까다로운.기분이 언짢은,(문제 따위가)난해한.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sour,peevish.
예문: The children avoided the crabbed old man because he scolded them when they made noise.
crass
우리말 뜻: 거친, 상스런,우둔한.어리석은.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: very unrefined,grossly insensible.
예문: The philosothers deplored the crass commercialism.
craven.
우리말 뜻: 겁많은,비겁한. 비열한,
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cowardly
예문: When he saw the enemy troops advancing, he had a craven impulse to run for his life.
credence
우리말 뜻: 믿음,신용, 신뢰.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: belief
예문: Do not place any credence in his promises.
credence
우리말 뜻: 믿음,신용, 신뢰.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: belief
예문: Do not place any credence in his promises.
credence
우리말 뜻: 믿음,신용, 신뢰.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: belief
예문: Do not place any credence in his promises.
credo
우리말 뜻: 신조,사도신경.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: creed
예문: I believe we may best describe his creco by saying that it approximates the Golden Rule.
credulity
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: belief on slight evidence.
예문: The witch doctor took advantage of the credulity of the suoerstitious natives.
creed
우리말 뜻: 교의,신조,주의.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: system of religious of ethical belief.
예문: In any loyal American's creed, love of democracy must be emthasized.
cresendo
우리말 뜻: 점강음,점점세짐.클라이막스.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: increase in the volume or intensity,as in a musical passage.climax.
예문: The overture suddenly changed from a quiet pastoral theme to a crescendo featuring blaring trumpets and clashing cymbals.
crestfallen
우리말 뜻: 풀이 죽은,의기소침한,
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dejected, dispirited,
예문: We were surprised at his teaction to the failure of his project;instead of being crestfallen,he was busily engaged in planning new activities.
cull
우리말 뜻: 고르다, 추려내다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pick out, single out
예문: Every month the farmer culls the nonlaying hens from his flock and sells them to the local butcher.
culmination
우리말 뜻: 최고점, 전성기
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: attainment of highest point
예문: His inauguration as president of the United States marked the culmination of his political career.
culpable
우리말 뜻: 비난 받을 만한, 과실이 있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deserving blame
예문: Corrupt politicians who condone the activities of the gamblers are equally culpable.
culvert
우리말 뜻: 암거, 지하수로
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: artificial channel for water
예문: If we build a culvert under the road, we will reduce the possibility of the road's being flooded during the rainy season.
cumbersome
우리말 뜻: 무거운, 다루기 어려운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: heavy, hard to manage
예문: He was burdened down with cumbersome parcels
cumulative
우리말 뜻: 점증적인, 누가적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: growing by addition
예문: Vocabulary building is a cumulative process.
cupidity
우리말 뜻: 탐욕
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: greed
예문: The defeated people couldn not satisfy the cupidityn of the conquerors.
curator
우리말 뜻: 관리자, 감독
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: superintendent, manager
예문: The members of the board of trustees of the museum expected the new curator to plan popular events and exhibitions.
curmudgeon
우리말 뜻: 구두쇠
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: churlish, miserly individual
예문: Although he was regarded by many as a curmudgeon, a few of us were aware of his kindnesses and acts of charity.
cursive
우리말 뜻: 흘려 쓴, 초서체의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flowing, running
예문: In normal writing we run our letters together in cursive form.
cursory
우리말 뜻: 피상적인, 겉핥기식의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: casual, hastily done
예문: A cursory exam. of the ruins indicates the possibility of arson.
curtail
우리말 뜻: 단축하다, 삭감하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: shorten, reduce
예문: During the coal shortage, we must curtail our use of this vital commodity.
cynical
우리말 뜻: 냉소적인, 남을 믿지 않는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: skeptical, distrustful of human motives
예문: Cynical at all times, he was suspicious of all altruistic actions of others.
cynosure
우리말 뜻: 남의 이목을 끄는 것, 찬미의 대상
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: the object of general attention
예문: As soon as the movie star intered the room, she became the cynosure of all eyes.
dais
우리말 뜻: (귀빈, 강연자를 위한) 단, 연단
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: raised platform for guests of honor
예문: When he approached the dais, he was greeted by cheers from the people who has come to honor him.
dally
우리말 뜻: 희롱하다, 가지고 놀다; 꾸물거리다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: trifle with, procrastinate
예문: Laertes told Ophelia that Hamlet could only dally with her affection.
dank
우리말 뜻: 축축한, 습기가 많은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: damp
예문: The walls of the dungeon were dank and slimy.
dapper
우리말 뜻: 산뜻한, 말쑥한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: neat and trim
예문: An excessively dapper soul who could not stand to have a hair out of place.
dappled
우리말 뜻: 얼룩 덜룩한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: spotted
예문: The sunlight filtering through the screens created a dappled effect on the wall.
daub
우리말 뜻: 칠하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: smear(as with paint)
예문: He daubed his paint on the canvas.
daunt
우리말 뜻: -을 위협하다, 겁나게 하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: intimidate
예문: Your threats can not daunt me.
dauntless
우리말 뜻: 대담한, 두려움을 모르는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bold
예문: The dauntless soldier volunteered for the assignment.
dawdle
우리말 뜻: 시간을 낭비하다. 꾸물거리다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: loiter, waste time
예문: Inasmuch as we must meet a deadline, do not dawdle over this work.
deadlock
우리말 뜻: 막다른 상태, 정체
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: standstill, stalemate
예문: The negotiations had reached a deadlock.
deadpan
우리말 뜻: 무표정의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: wooden, impassive
예문: We wanted to see how long he could maintain his deadpan ｅxpression.
dearth
우리말 뜻: 부족, 결핍
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: scarcity
예문: The dearth of skilled labor compelled the employers to open trade schools.
debacle
우리말 뜻: 와해, 대몰락
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: breaking up, downfall
예문: This debacle in the government can only result in anarchy.
debase
우리말 뜻: (인격 따위를) 떨어 뜨리다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reduce to lower state
예문: Do not debase yourself by becoming maudlin.
debauch
우리말 뜻: -을 타락시키다, 유혹하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: corrupt, make intemperate
예문: A vicious newspaper can debauch public ideals.
debilitate
우리말 뜻: 약화시키다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: weaken, enfeeble
예문: Overindulgence debilitates character as well as physical stamina.
debonair
우리말 뜻: 예의가 바른, 공손한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: friendly, aiming to please
예문: The debonair youth was liked by all who met him.
debris
우리말 뜻: (파괴물의) 파편, 잔해
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: rubble
예문: A full year after the earthquake in Maxico, they were still carting away the debris.
debunk
우리말 뜻: -의 정체를 폭로하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: expose as false, exaggerated, worthless
예문: Reporters debunked the candidate's claim that he was a fervent environmentalist.
debutante
우리말 뜻: 첫 무대를 밟는 여배우
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: young woman making formal entrance into society
예문: As a debutante, she was often mentioned in the society columns of the newspapers.
decadence
우리말 뜻: 쇠퇴, 타락
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: decay
예문: The moral decadence of the people was reflected in the lewd literature of the period.
decant
우리말 뜻: (술 따위를) 가만히 따르다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pour off gently
예문: Be sure to decant this wine before serving it.
decapitate
우리말 뜻: 목을 베다, 참수형에 처하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: behead
예문: They did not hang Lady Jane Grey; they decapitated her.
decelerate
우리말 뜻: 감속하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: slow down
예문: Seeing the emergency blinkers in the road ahead, he decelerated quickly.
deciduous
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: falling off, as of leaves
예문: The oak is a deciduous tree.
decimate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: kill, usually one dut of ten.
예문: We do more to decimate our population in automobile accidents than we do in war,
decipher
우리말 뜻: 암호를 풀다, 암호해독하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: decode
예문: I could not decipher the doctor's handwriting.
declivity
우리말 뜻: 내리막, 경사
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: downward slope
예문: The children loved to ski down the declivity.
decollete
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: having a low-cut neckline.
예문: Fashion decrees that eveing gowns be decollete this season; bare shoulders are again the vogue.
decomposition
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: decay.
예문: Despite the body's advanced state of decomposition, the police were able to identify the murdered man.
decorum
우리말 뜻: 예절
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: propriety ;seemliness
예문: Shocked by the unruly behavior, the teacher criticized the class for it's lack of decorum
decoy
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lure or bait
예문: The wild ducks were not fooled by the decoy.
decrepitude
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: state of collapse caused by illness or old age
예문: I was unprepared for the state of decrepitude in which I had found my old friend ; he seemed to have aged twenty years in six months.
decry
우리말 뜻: 비난하다, 욕하다, 경멸하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: express strong disapproval of;disparage.
예문: The founder of the Children's Defense Fund, Marian Wright Edelman, strongly decries the lack of financial and moral support for children in America today.
deducible
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: derived by reasoning.
예문: If we accept your premise, your conclusions are easily deducible.
deface
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mar; disfigure
예문: If you deface a library book, you will have to pay a hefty fine.
defamation
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harming a person's reputation.
예문: Such defamation of character may result in a slander suit.
default
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: failure to do
예문: As a result of her husband's failure to appear in court, she was granted a devorce by default
defeatist
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: resigned to defeat; accepting defeat as a natural outcome.
예문: If you maintain your defeatist attitude, you will never succeed.
defection
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: desertion.
예문: The children, who had made him an idol, were hurt most by his defection from our cause.
deference
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: courteous regard for another's wish.
예문: In deference to his desires, the employers granted him a holiday.
defile
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pollute; propane.
예문: The hoodlums defiled the church with their scurrilous writing.
definitive
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: most reliable or complete.
예문: Carl Sandburg's Abraham Lincoln may be regarded as the definitive work on the life of the Great Emancipator.
deflect
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: turn aside.
예문: His life was saved when his cigarette case deflected the bullet.
defoliate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: destroy leaves.
예문: In Vietnam the army made extensive use of chemical agents to defoliate the woodlands.
defray
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: provide for the payment of.
예문: Her employer offered to defray the costs of her postgraduate education
defrock
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: to strip a priest or minister of church authority.
예문: We knew the minister had violated church regulations, but we had not realized his offense was serious enough to cause him to be deflocked.
deft
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: neat;skillful
예문: The deft waiter uncorked the champagne without spilling a drop.
defunct
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dead; no longer in use or existence.
예문: the lawyers sought to examine the books of the defunct corporation.
degenerate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: become worse; deteriorate.
예문: As the fight dragged on, the champion's style degenerated until he could barely keep on his feet.
degraded
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lowed in rank; debased.
예문: The degraded wretch spoke only of his past glories and honors.
dehydrate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: remove water from; dry out.
예문: Vigorous dancing quickly dehydrates the body; between dances, besure to drink more water than normal.
deify
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: turn into a god; idolize.
예문: Admire the rock star all you want; just don't deify him.
deign
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: condescend.
예문: He felt that he would debase himself if he deigned to answer his critics.
delete
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: erase; strike out.
예문: If you delete this paragraph, the composition will have more appeal.
deleterious
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harmful
예문: Workers in nuclear research must avoid the deleterious effects of radioactive substances.
deliberate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: consider;ponder.
예문: Offered the new job, she asked for time to deliberate before she made her decision.
delineate
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: portrary.
예문: He is a powerful storyteller, but he is weakest when he attempts to delineate character.
delirium
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mental disorder marked by confusion.
예문: The drunkard in his delirium saw strange animals.
delta
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flat plainof mud or sand between branches of a river.
예문: His dissertation discussed the effect of intermittent flooding on the fertility of Nile delta.
delude
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deceive.
예문: Do not delude yourself into believing that he will relent.
deluge
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flood; rush.
예문: When we advertised the position, we received a deluge of applications.
delusion
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: false belief; hallucination
예문: This scheme is a snare and a delusion.
delusive
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deceptive;raising vain hopes.
예문: Do not raise your hopes on the basis of his delusive promises.
delve
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dig; investigate.
예문: Delving into old books and manuscripts is part of a researcher's job.
demagogue
우리말 뜻:
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: person who appeals to people's prejudice; false leader.
예문: He was accused of being a demagogue becausehe made premises that aroused futile hopes in his listeners.
demean
우리말 뜻: 품위를 떨어뜨리다,수치를 주다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: degrade,humilitate
예문: He felt that he would demean himself if he replied to the scurrilous letter.
derogatory
우리말 뜻: 품위가 없는, 품위를 손상시키는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. expressing a low opinion
예문: I resent your derogatory remarks.
descry
우리말 뜻: 식별하다, 알아보다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. catch sight of
예문: In the distance, we could barely descry the enemy vessels.
desecrate
우리말 뜻: 신성함을 더럽히다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. profane; violate the sanctity of
예문: The soldiers desecrated the temple.
desiccate
우리말 뜻: 습기를 제거하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. dry up
예문: A tour of this smokehouse will give you an idea of how the pioneers used to desiccate food in order to preserve it.
desolate
우리말 뜻: 황폐케하다, 저버리다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. rob of joy; lay waste to; forsake. ADJ.
예문: The bandits desolated the countryside, burning farms and carrying off the harvest.
despicable
우리말 뜻: 비열한, 경멸스런
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. contemptible
예문: Your despicable remarks call for no reply.
despise
우리말 뜻: 경멸하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. scorn.
예문: I despise your attempts at a reconciliation at this tine abd refuse to meet you.
despoil
우리말 뜻: 약탈하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. plunder
예문: If you do not yield, I am afraid the enemy will despoil the countryside.
despondent
우리말 뜻: 낙심한, 풀이죽은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. depressed;gloomy. despondency, N.
예문: To the dismay of his parents, he became more and more despondent every day.
despotism
우리말 뜻: 압제, 독제, 억압
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: tyranny
예문: The people rebelled against the despotism of the king.
destitute
우리말 뜻: 가난한, 궁핍한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: extremely poor
예문: The illness left the family destitute.
desuetude
우리말 뜻: 무용, 쓰이지 않음
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disused condition
예문: The machinery in the idle factory was in a state of desuetude.
desultory
우리말 뜻: 체계성이 없는, 마구잡이식의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: aimless; unsystematic; jumping around
예문: The animals' desultory behavior indicated that they had no awareness of their predicament.
detached
우리말 뜻: 공정한, 초연한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. emorionally removed; calm and ovjective; indifferent.
예문: A psychoanalyst must maintain a detached point of wiew and stay uninvolved with her patients' personal lives.
detergent
우리말 뜻: 세제
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cleansing agent
예문: Many new detergents have replaced soap.
determinate
우리말 뜻: 확정적인, 확고한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. having a fixed order of procedure; invariable.
예문: At the royalwedding, the procession of the nobles followed a determinate order of precedence.
deterrent
우리말 뜻: 방해물
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. something that discourahes; hindrance.
예문: Does the threat of capital punishment serve as a deterrent to potential killers?
detonation
우리말 뜻: 폭발
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: explosion
예문: The detonation could be heard miles away.
detraction
우리말 뜻: 중상, 비방
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: slandering; aspersion
예문: He is offended by your frequent detractions from his ability as a leader.
detriment
우리말 뜻: 해, 저해, 방해
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: harm; damage
예문: Your acceptance of his support will ultimately prove to be a detriment rather than an aid to your cause.
detrimental
우리말 뜻: 해로운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. harmful; damaging.
예문: Your acceptance of her support will ultimately prove detrimental rather than helpful to your cause.
deviate
우리말 뜻: 일탈하다, 벗어나다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: turn away from
예문: Do not deviate from the truth.
devious
우리말 뜻: 일탈적인, 비정상적인, 악한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: going astray; erratic
예문: Your devious behavior in this matter puzzles me since you are usually direct and straightforward.
devoid
우리말 뜻: 결핍된,없는, 부족한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lacking
예문: He was devoid of any personal desire for gain in his endeavor to secure improvement in the community.
devolve
우리말 뜻: 위임하다, 맡기다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deputize; pass to others
예문: It devolved upon us, the survivors, to arrange peace terms with the enemy.
devotee
우리말 뜻: 헌신자, 열성자
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: enthusiastic follower
예문: A devotee of the opera, he bought season tickets every year.
devout
우리말 뜻: 독신한, 헌신적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pious
예문: The devout man prayed daily.
dexterous
우리말 뜻: 솜씨좋은, 능란한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. skillful
예문: The magician was so dexterous that we could not follow his movements as he performed his tricks.
dextrous
우리말 뜻: 솜씨가 좋은, 손재주가 좋은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: skillful
예문: The magician was so dextrous that we could not follow his movements as he performed his tricks.
diabolical
우리말 뜻: 사악한, 악마의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: devilish
예문: This scheme is so diabolical that I must reject it.
diadem
우리말 뜻: 왕관
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: crown
예문: The king's diadem was on display at the museum.
dialectic
우리말 뜻: 논리적 토론술; 변증법
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: art of debate
예문: I am not skilled in dialectic and, therefore, cannot answer your arguments as forcefully as I wish.
diaphanous
우리말 뜻: 투명한, 비치는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sheer; transparent
예문: They saw the burglar clearly through the daiphanous curtain.
diatribe
우리말 뜻: 통렬한 비난
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. bitter scolding; invective.
예문: During the lengthy diatribe delivered by his opponent he remained calm and self-controlled.
dichotomy
우리말 뜻: 분지, 나누어짐
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. branching into two parts.
예문: The dichotomy of our legislative system provides us with many safeguards.
dictum
우리말 뜻: 선언, 언명
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. authoritative and weighty statemnent.
예문: She repeated the statement as though it were the dictum of the most expert worker in the group.
didactic
우리말 뜻: 교훈적인, 훈시적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. teaching; instructional; preaching or moralizing
예문: The didactic qualities of his poetry overshadow its literary qualities; the lesson he teaches is more memorable than the lines.
die
우리말 뜻: 금형
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. device for stamping or impressing; mold
예문: In coining pennies, workers at the old mint squeezed sheets of softened copper between two dies.
diffidence
우리말 뜻: 자신없음, 수줍음
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. shyness
예문: You must overcome your diffidence if you intend to become a salesperson.
diffusion
우리말 뜻: 확산
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. wordiness; spreading in all directions like a gas.
예문: Your composition suffers from a diffusion of ideas; try to be more compact.
digression
우리말 뜻: 본론에서 벗어남
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. wandering away from the subject
예문: Nobody minded when Professor Renoir's lectures wandered away from their official theme; his digressions were always more fascinating than the topic of the day.
dilapidated
우리말 뜻: 황폐한, 파손된
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. ruined because of neglect
예문: We felt that the dilapidated building needed several coats of paint.
dilate
우리말 뜻: 팽창시키다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: V. expand
예문: In the dark, the pupils of your eyes dilate.
dilatory
우리말 뜻: 꾸물거리는, 지체하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. delaying
예문: Your dilatory tactics may compel me to cancel the contract.
dilatory
우리말 뜻: 꾸물거리는, 지체하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ADJ. delaying
예문: Your dilatory tactics may compel me to cancel the contract.
dilemma
우리말 뜻: 궁지
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: N. problem; choice of two unsatisfactory alternatives
예문: In this dilemma, he knew no one to whom he could turn for advice.
dishearten
우리말 뜻: 낙심시키다, 용기를 잃게 하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: discourage
예문: His failure to pass the bar exam disheartened him.
disheveled
우리말 뜻: (머리털이)흐트러진, 헝클어진, 옷차림이 단정치 못한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: untidy
예문: Your disheveled appearance will hurt your chances in the interview.
disinclination
우리말 뜻: 마음이 내키지 않음, 싫증
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unwillingness
예문: Some mornings I feel a great disinclination to get our of bed.
disingenuous
우리말 뜻: 엉큼한, 음흉한, 계산적인,부정직한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: not naive, sophisticated
예문: Although he was young, his remarks indicated that he was disingenuous.
disinter
우리말 뜻: ..을 (땅속,무덤에서)파내다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dig up, unearth
예문: They disinterred the body and held an autopsy.
disinterested
우리말 뜻: 사심이 없는, 편견이 없는, 공평한, 냉담한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unprejudiced
예문: The only disinterested person in the room was the judge.
disjointed
우리말 뜻: 관절이 퉁겨진, 혼란한, 체계가 서지 않은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disconnected
예문: His remarks were so disjointed that we could not follow his reasoning.
dislodge
우리말 뜻: 제거하다, 없애다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: remove(forcibly)
예문:
dismantle
우리말 뜻: (가구,기구, 설비를)..에서 제거하다, 철거하다, 분해하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: take apart
예문: When the show closed, they dismantled the scenery before storing it.
dismember
우리말 뜻: 팔, 다리를 따로따로 하다, 나라등을 분할, 해체하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cut into small parts
예문: When the Austrian Empire was dismembered, several new countries were established.
dismiss
우리말 뜻: 포기하다, 제거하다, 잊어버리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: put away from consideration, reject
예문: Believing in John's love for her, she dismissed the notion that he might be unfaithful.
disparage
우리말 뜻: 깔보다, 과소 평가하다, 혈뜯다, 비난하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: belittle
예문: do not disparage anyone's contribution ; these little gifts add up to large sums
disparate
우리말 뜻: 이종의, 본질적으로 다른, 연관이 없는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: basicallu different, unrelated
예문: It is difficult, if not impossible, to organize these disparate elements into a coherent whole.
disparity
우리말 뜻: 불일치, 불평등, 불균형
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: difference, condition of inequality
예문: The disparity in their ages made no difference at all.
dispassionate
우리말 뜻: 감정에 흔들리지 않는, 냉정한, 공정한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: calm, impartial
예문: In a dispassionate analysis of the problem, he carefully examined the causes of the conflict and proceeded to suggest suitable remedies.
dispatch
우리말 뜻: (일따위의)재빠른 처리, 신속함, 급속 공문서
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: speediness, prompt execution, message sent with all due speed
예문: Young Napoleon defeated the enemy with all possible dispatch; he then sent a dispatch to headquarters, informing his commander of the great victory.
dispel
우리말 뜻: ..을 쫓아버리다, 사방으로 흩어지게 하다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: scatter
예문: The police fired tear gas into the crowd to disperse the protesters.
disperse
우리말 뜻: ..을 흩어지게 하다, 산란시키다, 산개시키다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: scatter
예문: The police fired the tear gas into the crowd to disperse the protesters.
dispirited
우리말 뜻: 기가 꺽인, 풀이 죽은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lacking in spirit
예문: The coach used all the tricks at his command to buoy up the enthusiasm of his team, which had become dispirited at the loss of the star player.
disport
우리말 뜻: 흥겹게 놀다, 즐기다, 장난하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: amuse
예문: The popularity of Florida as a winter resort is constantly increasing; each year, thousands more disport themselves at Miami Palm Beach.
disputatious
우리말 뜻: 논쟁적인, 논쟁을 좋아하는, 논쟁하는 대상이 되는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: argumentative; fond of argument
예문: People avoided discussing contemporary problems with him because of his disputatious manner.
disquisition
우리말 뜻: 탐구, 논문, 논고
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: a formal systematic inquiry; an explanation of the results of a formal inquiry
예문: In his disquisition, he outlined the steps he had taken in reaching his conclusions.
dissection
우리말 뜻: 절개, 해부, 해체, 분석
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: analysis; cutting apart in order to examine
예문: the dissection of frogs in the laboratory is particularly unpleasant to some students.
dissemble
우리말 뜻: 숨기다, 가장하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disguise; pretend
예문: Even though you are trying to dissemble your motive in joining this group, we can see through your pretense.
disseminate
우리말 뜻: 퍼트리다, 전파하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: scatter(like seeds)
예문: The invention of the radio has helped propagandists to disseminate their favorite doctrines very easily.
dissent
우리말 뜻: 의견을 달리하다, 동의하지 않다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disagree
예문: In the recent Supreme Court dicision, Justice Marshall dissented from the majority opinion.
dissertation
우리말 뜻: (특히 박사학위)논문, 논설
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: formal essay
예문: In order to earn a graduate degree from many of our universities, a candidate is frequently required to prepare a dissertation on some scholarly subject.
dissident
우리말 뜻: 의견을 달리하는, 반대하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dissenting; rebellious
예문: In the purge that followed the student demonstrations at Tianamen Square, the government hunted down the dissident students and their supporters.
dissimulate
우리말 뜻: (감정등을) 숨기다, ..인체 하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: pretend; conceal by feigning
예문: She tried to dissimulate her grief by her exuberant attitude.
dissipate
우리말 뜻: (구름, 안개따위를)흩뜨리다, 낭비하다, 탕진하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: squander
예문: The young man quickly dissipated his inheritance and was soon broke.
dissolution
우리말 뜻: 분리, 해체, 해산
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disintegration, looseness in morals
예문: The profligacy and dissolution of life in Caligula's Rome appall some historians.
dissonance
우리말 뜻: 불협화음, 부조화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: discord
예문: some contemporary musicians deliberately use dissonance to achieve certain effects.
dissuade
우리말 뜻: 충고하여 단념시키다.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: advise against
예문: He could not dissuade his friend from joining the conspirators.
distant
우리말 뜻: (거리적으로) 떨어진, 먼;태도가 쌀쌀한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reserved or aloof; could in manner
예문: His distant greeting made me feel unwelcome from the start.
distend
우리말 뜻: 팽창시키다, 부풀다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: expand; swell out
예문: I can tell when he is under stress by the way the veins distend on his forehead.
distill
우리말 뜻: ..을 증류하다, 정제하다, 만들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: purify; refine; concentrate
예문: A moonshiner distills mash into whisky; an epigrammatist distills thoughts into quips.
distortion
우리말 뜻: 왜곡, 뒤틀린 상태, 곡해
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: twisting out of shape
예문: It is difficult to believe the newspaper accounts of this event because of the distortions and exaggerations written by the reporters.
distrait
우리말 뜻: 멍한, 방심상태의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: absent-minded
예문: because of his conentration on the problem, the professor often appeared distrait and unconcerned about routine.
distraught
우리말 뜻: 마음이 산란한, 미친듯한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: upset; distracted by anxiety
예문: The distraught parents frantically searched the ravine for their lost child.
diurnal
우리말 뜻: 매일의, 날마다의, 대낮의, 하루동안의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: daily
예문: A farmer cannot neglect his diurnal tasks at any time; cows, for example, must be milked regularly.
diva
우리말 뜻: 가극의 주역 여성 가수, 프리마돈나
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: operatic singer; prima donna
예문: Although world famous as a diva, she did not indulge in fits of temperament.
diverge
우리말 뜻: 갈라져 나오다, 분기하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: vary; go in different directions from the same point
예문: The spokes of the wheel diverge from the hub.
divergent
우리말 뜻: 벗어난, 이탈하는, 갈라지는, 분기하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: differing, deviating
예문: The two witnesses presented the jury with remarkably divergent accounts of the same episode.
divest
우리말 뜻: 벗기다, 박탈하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: strip, deprive
예문: He was divested of his power to act
divination
우리말 뜻: 마력의 도움으로 미래를 예시함
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: foeseeing the future with the aid of magic
예문: I base my opinions not on any special gift of divination but on the laws of probability
divulge
우리말 뜻: 폭로하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reveal
예문: I will not tell you this news because I am sure you will divulge it prematurely
docile
우리말 뜻: 순종하는, 쉽게 조종되는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: obedient, easily managed
예문: As docile as he seems today, that old lion was once a ferocious, snarling beast.
docket
우리말 뜻: 미결소송사건 일람표
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: program, as for trial; book where such entries are made
예문: The case of Smith vs. Jones was entered in the docket for July 15.
doddering
우리말 뜻: 흔들리는, 늙어서 떨리는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: shaky, infirn from old age
예문: Although he is not as yet a doddering and senile old man, his ideas and opinions no longer can merit the respect we gave them years ago.
doff
우리말 뜻: 벗다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: take off
예문: He doffed his hat to the lady
doggerel
우리말 뜻: 보잘것 없는 시
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: poor verse
예문: Although we find occasional snatches of genuine poetry in his writing is mere doggerel.
dogmatic
우리말 뜻: 적극적인, 독단적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: arbitrary, dictatorial
예문: Do not be so dogmatic about that statement; it can be easily refuted.
dolorous
우리말 뜻: 슬픔에 찬
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sorrowful
예문: He found the dolorous lamentations of the bereaved family emotionally disturbing and he left as quickly as he could.
dolt
우리말 뜻: 바보같은 사람
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: stupid person
예문: I thought I was talking to a mature audience; instead, I find myself addressig a pack of dolts and idiots.
domicile
우리말 뜻: 집, 주소
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: home
예문: Although his legal domicile was in New York city, his work kept him away from his residence for many years.
dormant
우리말 뜻: 잠자는, 혼수상태의, 동면한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sleeping, lethargic, torpid
예문: Sometimes dormant talents in our friends surprise those of us who never realized how gifted acquaintances really were.
dorsal
우리말 뜻: 동물의 등의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: relating to the back of an animal
예문: A shark may be identified by its dorsal in which projects above the sunfac of the ocean.
dotage
우리말 뜻: 노쇠, 망령
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: senility
예문: In his dotage, the old man bored us with long tales of events in his childhood.
doughty
우리말 뜻: 용기있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: courageous
예문: Many folk tales have sprung up about this doughty pioneer who opened up the New World for his followers.
dour
우리말 뜻: 부루뚱한, 완고한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sullen, stubborn
예문: The man was dour and taciturn.
dregs
우리말 뜻: 침전물, 무가친한 잔재
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sediment, worthless residue
예문: The dregs of society may be observed in this slum area of the city.
droll
우리말 뜻: 이상하고 즐거운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: queer and amusing
예문: He was a popular guest because his droll anecdotes were always entertaining.
dross
우리말 뜻: 폐기물, 무가치한 불순물
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: waste matter, worthless impurities
예문: Many methods have been devised to separate the valuable metal from the dross.
drudgery
우리말 뜻: 힘드는 육체 노동
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: menial work
예문: Cinderella's fairy godmother rescued her from a life of drudgery.
dubious
우리말 뜻: 의심스런
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: doubtful
예문: He has the dubious dinctition of being the lowest ranked member of his class.
duenna
우리말 뜻: 소녀감독부, 여성보호자
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: attendant of young female, chaperone
예문: Their romance could not flourish because of the presence of her duenna.
dulcet
우리말 뜻: 감미로운 소리가 나는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sweet sounding
예문: The dulcet sounds of the birds at dawn were soon drowned out by the roar of traffic passing our motel.
duplicity
우리말 뜻: 이중성, 위선
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: double-dealing, hypocrisy
예문: People were shocked and dismayed when they learned of his duplicity in this affair for he had always seemed honest and straightforward.
durance
우리말 뜻: 억제, 감금
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: restraint, imprisonment
예문: The lecturer spoke of a "durance vile" to describe his years in the prison camp.
ecelctic
우리말 뜻: 취사선택하는. 절충주의의. (취미등이) 다방면에 걸친.
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: selective. composed of elements drawn from disparate sources.
예문: His style of interior decoration was eclectic : bits and pieces of furnishings from widely divergent periods, strikingly juxtaposed to create a unique decor.
finite
우리말 뜻: 한정된
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: limited
예문: It is difficult for humanity with its finite existence to grasp the infinite.
firebrand
우리말 뜻: 횃불; 말썽꾼
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: hothead; troublemaker
예문: The police tried to keep track of all the local firebrands when the President came to town.
fissure
우리말 뜻: 갈라진 틈
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: crevice
예문: The mountain climbers secured footholds in tiny fissures in the rock.
fitful
우리말 뜻: 발작적인; 단속적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: spasmodic; intermittent
예문: After several fitful attempts, he decided to postpone the start of the project until he felt more energetic.
flag
우리말 뜻: 축 늘어지다; 시들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: droop; grow feeble
예문: When the opposing hockey team scored its third goal only minutes into the first quarter, the home team's knotted flagged.
flagellate
우리말 뜻: 채찍질하다; 힐난하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flog; whip
예문: The Romans used to flagellate criminals with a whip that had three violations of the rules.
flagrant
우리말 뜻: 극악한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: conspicuously wicked
예문: We cannot condone such flagrant violations of the rules.
flail
우리말 뜻: 도리깨질하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thresh grain by hand; strke or slap
예문: In medieval times, warriors flailed their foe with a metal ball attached to a handle.
flair
우리말 뜻: 재능
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: talent
예문: She has an uncanny flair for discovering new artists before the public has become aware of their existence.
flamboynat
우리말 뜻: 화려한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ornate
예문: Modern architecture has discarded the flamboyant trimming on buildings and emphasizes simplicity of line.
flaunt
우리말 뜻: 과시하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: display ostentatiously
예문: She is not one of those actresses who flaunt their physical charms; she can act.
fledgling
우리말 뜻: 미숙한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: inexperienced
예문: While it is necessary to provide these fledgling poets with an opportunity to present their work, it is not essential that we admire everything they write.
fleece
우리말 뜻: 양털
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: wool coat of a sheep
예문: They shear sheep of their fleece, whcih they then comb into separate strands of wool.
flippancy
우리말 뜻: 경솔
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: trifling gaiety
예문: Your flippancy at this serious moment is offensive.
flippant
우리말 뜻: 경솔한, 건방진
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lacking proper seriousness
예문: When Mark told Mona he loved her, she dismissed his earnest declaration with a flippant "Oh, you say that to all the girls!"
flit
우리말 뜻: 재빨리 날아가다; 날아가다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dart lightly; pass swiftly by; fly
예문: Like a bee flitting from flower to flower, Rose flitted from one boyfriend to the next
floe
우리말 뜻: 유빙
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mass of floating ice
예문: The ship made slow progress as it battered its way through the ice floes
flora
우리말 뜻: [한 지역 또는 한 시대에 특유한]식물[군]
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: plants of a region or era
예문: Because she was a botanist, she spent most of her time studying the flora of the desert
florid
우리말 뜻: 붉그레한; 붉은
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ruddy; reddish; flowery
예문: If you go to Florida and get a sunburn, your complexion will look florid.
flotsam
우리말 뜻: 표류하는 부스러기[쓰레기]
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: drifting wreckage
예문: Beachcombers eke out a living by salvaging the flotsam and jetsam of the sea
flounder
우리말 뜻: 몸부림치다; 서툴게 진행하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: struggle and thrash about; proceed clumsily or falter
예문: Up to his knees in the bog, Floyd floundered about, trying to regain his footing
flourish
우리말 뜻: 번성하다; 잘 자라다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: grow well; prosper; make sweeping gestures
예문: The orange trees flourished in the sun
flout
우리말 뜻: 거부하다; 비웃다; 무시하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: reject; mock
예문: The headstrong youth flouted all authority; he refused to be curbed
fluctuate
우리말 뜻: 흔들리다; 이동하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: waver; shift
예문: The water pressure in out shower fluctuates widly; you start rinsing yourself off with a trickle, and two minutes later a blast of water nearly knocks you off your feet. I'll never get used to these fluctuations
fluency
우리말 뜻: 유창함; 달변
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: smoothness of speech
예문: She spoke French with fluency and ease
fluke
우리말 뜻: 요행수
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unlikely occurrence; stroke of fortune
예문: When Douglas defeated Tyson for the heavyweight championship, some sportscasters dismissed his victory as a fluke
fluster
우리말 뜻: 당황하게 만들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: confuse
예문: The teacher's sudden question flustered him and he stammmered his reply
fluted
우리말 뜻: 홈이 있는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: having vertical parallel grooves(as in a pillar)
예문: All that remained of the ancient building were the fluted columns
flux
우리말 뜻: 흐름
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flowing; series of changes
예문: While conditions are in such a state of flux, I do not wish to commit myself too deeply in this affair
flux
우리말 뜻: 흐름
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: flowing; series of changes
예문: While conditions are in such a state of flux, I do not wish to commit myself too deeply in this affair
fodder
우리말 뜻: 가축의 먹이
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: coarse food for cattle, horses, etc
예문: one of Nancy's chores at the ranch was to put fresh supplies of fodder in the hores' stalls
foible
우리말 뜻: 사소한 실수
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: weakness; slight fault
예문: We can overlook the foibles of our friends; no one is perfect
foil
우리말 뜻: 대조
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: contrast
예문: In Star Wars, dark, evil Darth Vader is a perfect foil for fair-haired, naive Luke Skywalker
foist
우리말 뜻: 몰래 써넣다; 떠맡기다, 속여서 팔다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: insert improperly; palm off
예문: I will not permit you to foist such ridiculous idea upon the membership of this group
foliage
우리말 뜻: 잎(전부)
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: masses of leaves
예문: Every autumn before the leaves fell he promised himself he would drive through New England to admire the colorful fall foliage
foment
우리말 뜻: 선동하다, 유발하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: stir up; instigate
예문: Cher's archenemy Heather spread some nasty rumors that fomented trouble in the club. Do you think Cher's foe meant to foment such discord?
foolhardy
우리말 뜻: 무모한, 무작정한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: rash
예문: Don't be foolhardy. Get the advice of experienced people before undertaking this venture
foppish
우리말 뜻: 멋 부리는, 맵시내는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: vain about dress and appearance
예문: He tried to imitate the foppish manner of the young men of the court
foray
우리말 뜻: 습격, 공습
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: raid
예문: The company staged a midnight foray against the enemy outpost
forbearance
우리말 뜻: 인내
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: patience
예문: We must forbearance in dealing with him because he is still weak from his illness
ford
우리말 뜻: 여울
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: place where a river can be crossed on foot
예문: Rather than risk using the shaky rope bridge, David walked a half-mile downstream until he came to the nearest ford
forebears
우리말 뜻: 조상
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ancestors
예문: Reverence for one's forebears(sometimes referred to as ancestor worship) plays an important part in many Oriental cultures
foreboding
우리말 뜻: 육감, 예감, 불길한 일의 전조
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: premonition of evil
예문: Suspecting no conspiracies against him, Caesar gently ridiculed his wife's forebodings about the Ides of March
forensic
우리말 뜻: 법정의; 변론의, 토론의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: suitable to debate or courts of law
예문: In her best forensic manner, the lawyer addressed the jury
foreshadow
우리말 뜻: 예시하다, 징조를 보이다, -의 전조가 되다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: give an indication beforehand; portend; prefigure
예문: In retrospect, political analysts realized that Yeltsin's defiance of the attempted coup foreshadowed his emergence as the dominant figure of the new Russian republic
foresight
우리말 뜻: 예지
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ability to foresee future happenings; prudence
예문: A wise investor, she had the foresight to buy land just before the current real estate boom
forestall
우리말 뜻: 방지하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: prevent by taking action in advance
예문: By setting up a prenuptial agreement, the prospective bride and groom hoped to forestall any potential arguments about money in the event of a divorce
forgo
우리말 뜻: 포기하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: give up; do without
예문: Determined to lose weight for the summer, Ida decided to forgo dessert until she could fit into a size eight again
forlorn
우리말 뜻: 슬프고 외로운; 비참한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sad and lonely; wretched
예문: Deserted by her big sisters and her friends, the forlorn child sat sadly on the steps awaiting their return
formality
우리말 뜻: 의례; 형식적임
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ceremonious quality; something done just for form's sake
예문: The president received the visiting heads of state with due formality: flags waving, honor guards standing at attention, bands playing anthems at full blast. Signing this petition is a mere formality; it does not obligate you in any way
formidable
우리말 뜻: 위협적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: menacing; threatening
예문: We must not treat the battle lightly for we are facing a formidable foe
forsake
우리말 뜻: 버리다; 포기하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: desert; abandon;renounce
예문: No one expected Foster to forsake his wife and children and run off with another woman
forswear
우리말 뜻: 포기하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: renounce; abandon
예문: The captured knight could escape death only if he agreed to forswear christianity and embrace Islam as the one true faith
forte
우리말 뜻: 장점, 장기; 특기
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: strong point or special talent
예문: I'm not eager to play this rather serious role, for my forte is comedy
forthright
우리말 뜻: 직접적인; 솔직한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: straightforward; direct; frank
예문: I prefer Jill's forthright approach to Jack's tendency to beat around the bush
fortitude
우리말 뜻: 용감; 용기
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bravery; courage
예문: He was awarded the medal for his fortitude in the battle
fortuitous
우리말 뜻: 우연히
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: accidental; by chance
예문: Though he pretend their encounter was fortuitous, he'd actually been hanging around her usual haunts for the past two weeks, hoping she'd turn up
foster
우리말 뜻: 기르다; 양육하다; 조장하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: rear; encourage
예문: According to the legend, Romulus and Remus were fostered by a she-wolf that raised the abandoned infants as her own
founder
우리말 뜻: 완전히 실패하다, 침몰하다; (회사나 협회 등의) 발기인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fail completely, sink; person who establishes(an organization, business)
예문: After bitting the submerged iceberg, the Titanic started taking in water rapidly and soon foundered; Among those drowned when the Titanic sank was the founder of Abraham & Straus chain
founder
우리말 뜻: 완전히 실패하다, 침몰하다; (회사나 협회 등의) 발기인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fail completely, sink; person who establishes(an organization, business)
예문: After bitting the submerged iceberg, the Titanic started taking in water rapidly and soon foundered; Among those drowned when the Titanic sank was the founder of Abraham & Straus chain
fracas
우리말 뜻: 혼란; 혼전; 난투
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: brawl, melee
예문: The military police stopped the fracas in the bar and arrested the belligerents
fractious
우리말 뜻: 날뛰는, 고분고분하지 않은, 규칙을 지키지 않는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unruly
예문: The fractious horse unseated its rider
frail
우리말 뜻: 허약한, 가냘픈, 부서지기 쉬운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: weak
예문: The delicate child seemed too frail to lift the heavy carton
franchise
우리말 뜻: 사용권, 독점판매권, 선거권
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: right granted by authority; right to vote; license to sell a product in a particular territory
예문: The city issue a franchise to the company to operate surface transit lines on the streets for 99 years ; For most of American history women lacked the right to vote: not until the early twentieth century was the franchise granted to women ; Stan owns a Carvel's ice cream franchise in Chinatown
frantic
우리말 뜻: 미친 듯한, 광란한; 지독한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: wild
예문: At the time of the collision, many people became frantic with fear
fraudulent
우리말 뜻: 사기의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cheating; deceitful
예문: The government seeks to prevent fraudulent and misleading advertising
fraught
우리말 뜻: ...으로 찬; ..을 내포한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: filled
예문: Since this enterprise is fraught with danger, I will ask for volunteers who are willing to assume the risks
fray
우리말 뜻: 소란, 말다툼, 언쟁
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: brawl
예문: The three musketeers were in the thick of the fray
frenetic
우리말 뜻: 미친, 광적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: frenzied, frantic
예문: His frenetic activities convinced us that he had no organized plan of operation
frenzied
우리말 뜻: 광적인, 열광적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: madly excied
예문: As soon as they smelled smoke, the frenzied animals milled about in their cages
fresco
우리말 뜻: 프레스코화법(회반죽 위에 그리는 수채화법)
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: painting on plaster(usually fresh)
예문: The cathedral is visited by many tourists who wish to admire the frescoes by Giotto
fret
우리말 뜻: 귀찮게하다; 속타게 하다; 초조하게 하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: to be annoyed or vexed
예문: To fret over your poor grades is foolish; instead, decide to work harder in the future
friction
우리말 뜻: (의견)충돌; 마찰, 불화
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: clash in opinion; rubbing against
예문: At this time when harmony is essential, we cannot afford to have any friction in our group
frieze
우리말 뜻: 소벽(조각으로 장식한 경우가 많음); 띠 모양의 장식
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: ornamental band on a wall
예문: The frieze of the church was adorned with sculpture
frigid
우리말 뜻: 몹시 추운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: intensely cold
예문: Alaska is in the frigid zone
fritter
우리말 뜻: 낭비하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: waste
예문: He could not apply himself to any task and frittered away his time in idle conversation
frivolous
우리말 뜻: 천박(경박)한; 사소한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lacking in seriousness; self-indulgently carefree; relatively unimportant
예문: Though Nancy enjoyed Bill's frivolous, lighthearted companionship, she sometimes wondered whether he could ever be serious
frolicsome
우리말 뜻: 쾌활한; 명랑한; 장난을 좋아하는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: prankish; gay
예문: The frolicsome puppy tried to lick the face of its master
frond
우리말 뜻: 양치류 식물의 잎
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fern leaf; palm or banana leaf
예문: After the storm the beach was littered with the fronds of palm trees
fructify
우리말 뜻: 열매를 맺다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bear fruit
예문: This peach tree should fructify in three years
frugality
우리말 뜻: 절약
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thrift; economy
예문: In thes economically difficult days business must practice frugality or risk bankruptcy
frugality
우리말 뜻: 절약
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thrift; economy
예문: In thes economically difficult days business must practice frugality or risk bankruptcy
fruition
우리말 뜻: 결실; 실현
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: bearing of fruit; fulfillment; realization
예문: This building marks the fruition of all our aspirations and years of hard work
frustrate
우리말 뜻: 방해하다; 좌절시키다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thwart; defeat
예문: We must frustrate this dictator's plan to seize control of the government
fugitive
우리말 뜻: 사라져(없어져) 버리는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fleeting or transitory; roving
예문: The film brought a few fugitive images to her mind, but on the whole it made no lasting impression upon her
fulcrum
우리말 뜻: 지렛목; 지레받침
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: support on which a lever rests
예문: If we use this stone as a fulcrum and the crowbar as a lever, we may be able to move this boulder
fulminate
우리말 뜻: 폭발음을 내다; 소리지르다, 야단치다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: thunder; explode
예문: The people against whom she fulminated were innocent of any wrongdoing
fulsome
우리말 뜻: <아첨 등이> 지나친, 집요한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: disgustingly excessive
예문: His fulsome praise of the dictator annoyed his listeners
functionary
우리말 뜻: 공무원
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: official
예문: As his case was transferred from one functionary to another, he began to despair of ever reaching a settlement
fundamental
우리말 뜻: 기본적인; 근원의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: basic; primary; essential
예문: The committee discussed all sorts of side issues without ever getting down to addressing the fundamental problem
funereal
우리말 뜻: 슬픈; 장송의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sad; solemn
예문: I fail to understand why there is such a funereal atmosphere; we have lost a battle, not a war
furor
우리말 뜻: 열광; 격렬한 감격
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: frenzy; great excitement
예문: The story of her embezzlement of the funds created a furor on the stock exchange
furtive
우리말 뜻: 몰래 하는; 은밀한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: stealthy; sneaky
예문: Nothing the furtive glance the customer gave the diamond bracelet on the counter, the jeweler wondered whether he had a potential shoplifter on his hands
fusillade
우리말 뜻: 일제 사격; (질문,비난의) 연발
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: simultaneous firing or outburst(of missiles, questions, etc)
예문: Tchaikovsky's 1812 Overture concludes with a thunderous fusillade of cannon fire
fusion
우리말 뜻: 융해; 연합
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: union; coalition
예문: The opponents of the political party in power organized a fusion of disgruntled groups and became an important element in the election
futile
우리말 뜻: 효과없는; 쓸데없는; 무익한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: useless; hopeless; ineffectual; trifling
예문: It is futile for me to try to get any work done around here while the telephone is ringing every 30 seconds
gadfly
우리말 뜻: 등에; 귀찮은 사람
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: animal-biting fly; an irritating person
예문: Like a gadfly, he irritated all the guests at the hotel; within forty-eight hours, everyone regarded him as an annoying busybody
gaffe
우리말 뜻: (사교,외교상의) 과실, 실수
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: social blunder
예문: According to Miss Manners, to call your husband by your lover's name is worse than a mere gaffe; it is a tactical mistake
germinate
우리말 뜻: 싹이 트다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cause to sprout; sprout
예문: After the seeds germinate and develop their permanent leaves, the plants may be removed from the cold frames and transplanted to the garden.
gerrymander
우리말 뜻: <선거구를>자기 당에 유리하게 개정하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: change voting district lines in order to favor a political party
예문: The illogical pattern of the map of this congressional district is proof that the State Legislature gerrymandered this area in order to favor the majority party.
gestate
우리말 뜻: ~을 회태하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: evolve, as in prenatal growth
예문: While this scheme was being gestated by the conspirators, they maintained complete silence about their intentions.
gesticulation
우리말 뜻: 몸짓하기
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: motion; gesture
예문: Operatic performers are trained to make exaggerated gesticulation because of the large auditoriums in which they appear.
ghastly
우리말 뜻: 무시무시한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: horrible
예문: The murdered man was a ghastly sight.
gibber
우리말 뜻: 영문 모를 말을 지껄이다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: speak foolishly
예문: The demented man gibbered incoherently.
gibbet
우리말 뜻: 교수대
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: gallows
예문: The bodies of the highwaymen were left dangling from the gibbet as a warning to other would-be transgressors.
gibe
우리말 뜻: 놀려대다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: mock
예문: As you gibe at their superstitious beliefs, do you realize that you, too, are guilty of similarly foolish thoughts?
giddy
우리말 뜻: 현기증 나는; 아찔한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: light-herted; dizzy
예문: He felt his giddy youth was past.
gingerly
우리말 뜻: 아주 신중하게
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: very carefully
예문: She was asked to give the gist of the essay in two sentences.
gist
우리말 뜻: 요점
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: essence
예문: She was asked to give the gist of the essay in two sentences.
glaze
우리말 뜻: 유리를 끼우다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: cover with a thin and shiny surface
예문: The freezing rain glazed the streets and made driving hazardous.
glean
우리말 뜻: <이삭을>줍다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: gather leavings
예문: After the crops had been barvested by the machines, the peasants were permitted to glean the wheat left in the fields.
glib
우리말 뜻: 말 잘하느느
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: fluent
예문: He is a glib speaker.
gloat
우리말 뜻: 고소한 듯이 바라보다; 자못 흡족한듯이 바라보다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: express evil satisfaction; view malevolently
예문: As you gloat over your ill-gotten wealth, do you think of the many victims you have defrauded?
glossy
우리말 뜻: 광택이 나는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: smocth and shining
예문: I want this photograph printed on glossy paper.
glower
우리말 뜻: 상을 찡그리다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: scowl
예문: The angry boy glowered at his father.
glut
우리말 뜻: 과도하게 공급하다; 과도하게 채우다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: overstock; fill to excess
예문: The many manufacturers glutted the market and could not find purchasers for the many articles they had produced.
glutinous
우리말 뜻: 아교질의; 점착성의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: sticky; viscous
예문: Molasses is a glutinous substance.
gluttonous
우리말 뜻: 난쟁이; 땅 신령
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: dwarf; underground spirit
예문: The gluttonous boy ate all the cookies.
goad
우리말 뜻: 손동하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: urge on
예문: He was goaded by his friends until he yielded to their wishes.
gouge
우리말 뜻: 후벼내다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: tear out
예문: In that fight, all the rules were forgotten; the adversaries bit, kicked, and tried to gouge each other's eyes out.
gullible
우리말 뜻: 속기 쉬운
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: easily deceived
예문: He preyed upon gullible people, who believed his stories of easy wealth.
hackneyed
우리말 뜻: 진부한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: commonplace. trite
예문: The English teacher criticized her story because of its hackneyed and unoriginal plot.
haphazard
우리말 뜻: 우연한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: random. by chance
예문: His haphazard reading left him unacquainted with the authors of the book.
implement(v)
우리말 뜻: 실행하다, 시행하다; 장구를 제공하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: supply what is needed; furnish with tools
예문: I am unwilling to implement this plan until I have assurance that it has the full approval of your officials.
imply
우리말 뜻: 함축적으로 의미하다, 암시하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: suggest a meaning not expressed; signify
예문: Even though your statement does not declare that you are at war with that country, your actions imply that that is the actual situation.
imponderable
우리말 뜻: 무게가 없는, 무게를 알 수 없는; 평가할 수 없는, 헤아릴 수 없는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: weightless; unfathomable
예문: I can evaluate the data gathered in this study; the imponderable items are not so easily analyzed.
ingenuous
우리말 뜻: 순진한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: naive. young. unsophisticated
예문: These remarks indicate that you are ingenuous and unaware of life's harsher realities.
instigate
우리말 뜻: 시작하다. 일으키다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: urge. start. provoke
예문: I'm afraid that this statement will instigate a revolt.
inured
우리말 뜻: 익숙한; 단련된
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: accustomed; hardened
예문: He became inured to the Alaskan cold.
invalidate
우리말 뜻: 무효로 만들다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: weaken; destroy
예문: The relatives who received little or nothing sought to invalidate the will by claiming that the deceased had not been in his right mind when he had signed the document.
invective
우리말 뜻: 비난
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: abuse
예문: He had expected criticism but not the invective which greeted his proposal.
inveigh
우리말 뜻: 통렬히 비난하다; 욕설하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: denounce; utter censure or invective
예문: He inveighed against the demagoguery of the previous speaker and urged that the audience reject his philosophy as dangerous.
inveigle
우리말 뜻: 꾀다; 솔깃한 말로 속이다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: lead astray; wheedle
예문: She was inveigled into joining the club.
inverse
우리말 뜻: 반대의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: opposite
예문: There is an inverse ratio between the strength of light and its distance.
invert
우리말 뜻: 거꾸로 하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: turn upside down or inside out
예문: When he inverted his body in a hand stand, he felt the blood rush to his head.
inveterate
우리말 뜻: 뿌리깊은; 상습적인
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: deep-rooted; habitual
예문: She is an inveterate smoker.
invidious
우리말 뜻: 꽤씸한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: designed to create ill will or envy
예문: We disregarded her invidious remarks because we realized how jealous she was.
invincible
우리말 뜻: 무적의
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: unconquerable
예문: Superman is invincible.
inviolability
우리말 뜻: 신성
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: security from being destroyed, corrupted or profaned
예문: They respected the inviolability of her faith and did not try to change her manner of living.
invoke
우리말 뜻: 빌다; 호소하다
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: call upon; ask for
예문: She invoked her advisor's aid in filling out her financial aid forms.
invulnerable
우리말 뜻: 상하게 할 수 없는
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: incapable of injury
예문: Achilles was invulnerable except in his heel.
iota
우리말 뜻: 아주 조금
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: very samll quantity
예문: She hadn't an iota of common sense.
irascible
우리말 뜻: 성마른; 성급한
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: irritable; easily angered
예문: His irascible temper frightened me.
irate
우리말 뜻: 성난
영어 뜻 혹은 유의어: angry
